title: Trapping Rain Water
description: Given `n` non-negative integers representing an elevation map where the width of each bar is `1`, compute how much water it can trap after raining.

examples.explanation: The elevation map (black section) is represented by array [0,1,0,2,1,0,1,3,2,1,2,1]. In this case, 6 units of rain water (blue section) are being trapped.

hints: Water at any position is determined by the minimum of the maximum heights on both sides.
You can precompute the maximum height to the left and right of each position.
A two-pointer approach can solve this in O(1) space by processing from both ends.
